message:
Unofficial Lebanese sources: The number of casualties in the attack on Meiss al-Jabal has risen to 3.
The number of casualties today in the IDF attacks in southern Lebanon has risen to 9. 
The one killed in the motorcycle attack in Aitaroun was Palestinian.

Great video. well edited. It's fun to see it on Palestinian channels.
Well done 👏👏🫡

Video Credit: Division 162

https://www.instagram.com/amit_maymoni?igsh=ZjFvNzFmd2JhNnV5

Lebanese Ministry of Health:
One dead and one injured in a UAV attack on a motorcycle in Aitaroun in southern Lebanon.

In addition, one dead and two injured in the strike (fighter jet) in the village of Meiss al-Jabal in southern Lebanon.

##
This is in addition to the two dead in Aita al-Jabal and three Hezbollah operatives officially announced eliminated this morning in Tayr Harfa.
A productive day.
Lebanese sources report two fatalities in the Israeli drone strike in Ayta al-Jabal, southern Lebanon 👆.

Hezbollah announces three casualties in its ranks:

 Aqil Gharib
 Qassem Hurqus
 Hassan Hurqus

All three were killed in an IDF attack in Tayr Harfa this morning 👆.

Hezbollah has reported 425 casualties since the beginning of the war, with more expected.
Lebanese sources report that the Israeli drone launched two missiles in Ayta al-Jabal: one targeting a structure and another targeting a vehicle.
Lebanese sources report of casualties in an Israeli drone strike on a structure in Ayta al-Jabal in southern Lebanon.

Palestinians report that Israel decided unilaterally to release 40 prisoners from Ofer Camp yesterday.

Palestinian channels are now lamenting that some of the prisoners, particularly those who were overweight, have dramatically lost weight during their imprisonment. The family of Anan Bashkar from Nablus (first image), one of the released prisoners, issued a public statement last night apologizing for not being able to host his well-wishers until Anan "recovers at home from his time in prison."

Also attached are photos of Ata Jabali, another prisoner released yesterday (second image), showing him before and after his imprisonment.

Palestinian channels report that an IDF drone entered an apartment belonging to Nasser and Khaled Siam in the promenade area of Nuseirat in the central Gaza Strip (north Nuseirat). 

These sources claim that the drone dropped several grenades inside the apartment, causing the deaths of four members of the Siam family. 

It was also reported that another drone prevented Gazans from approaching the apartment until the “completion of the elimination.”

Sources in central Gaza report that armed men robbed the warehouse at Al-Nakhil Hall yesterday, where tons of meat donated by Saudi Arabia for Gaza residents were stored.

Gazan social media users reported heavy gunfire last night in Deir al-Balah during the robbery and later mentioned that the meat “returned to its rightful owners” - the residents of Gaza.

Some Gazan users noted that the market in Deir al-Balah will soon be flooded with meat as a result, and that barbecues have already been lit…
Hezbollah has claimed responsibility for this morning’s attack on the IDF’s Aerial Control Unit in Meron.
Lebanese Ministry of Health: Two killed and one injured in the IDF attack in Tayr Harfa. Later reports claim the number of killed has risen to three.
UNRWA: 250,000 Gazans have been displaced from their homes in the Gaza Strip following 12 evacuation orders issued by the IDF during the month of August.
The Pentagon: We are well-deployed militarily to defend Israel, should we be required.
Attack on the Zakut building👆 in Nuseirat in the central Gaza Strip yesterday, from another angle.

“The sea is before us and death is behind us.”

A Palestinian lament cartoon… 
Soon they will claim that its the Jews that want to throw the Arabs into the sea (: 
Once, the claims were the opposite…
Due to the evacuation warning, Gazans left their tents near the “al-Qudsia” outpost in Khan Yunis. After the strike, they returned to their tents.
Last night, following an evacuation warning, the IDF targeted the “Al-Qudsia” outpost of Hamas in the western part of Khan Yunis (al-Mawasi area) in southern Gaza.

IDF: A short while ago, a terrorist cell that was planning to fire projectiles from the area of Tayr Harfa in southern Lebanon toward Israeli territory was identified by IDF soldiers and eliminated by the IAF.

Following the elimination, a projectile launch was identified from the area, indicating the presence of weapons and rockets.

Additionally, IDF artillery struck to remove threats in the area of Chebaa in southern Lebanon.

Attached is a video of the strike.
Chicago, near the DNC: Pro-Palestinian protestors are blocking the road. One of the protestors smashed the windshield of a blocked vehicle.

And… calls praising the “Intifada” - which is the “only solution”, according the protestors outside the DNC. 

Chicago, USA.

This also happened outside the DNC:

Pro-Palestinitans are chanting:
Free Palestine
F*ck America 

Whilst setting the American flag on fire.

###
These two chants have become interconnected.

In the meantime, outside the Democratic National Convention pro-Palestinians are chanting:

F*ck The DNC, Free Palestine

And:

Killer Kamala
Do
Not
Come
For our votes
Trump, who covered Harris’s speech live in a video and responded to everything she said (and didn’t say), addressed Harris’s remarks on Israel and Gaza:

In a minute and a half, Harris said everything that both sides want to hear:

1. Emphasized her support for Israel.
2. Called Hamas a terrorist organization.
3. Acknowledged the sexual violence committed by Hamas.
4. "Balanced" her support for Israel with the suffering of Gazans.
5. Announced her efforts to end the war.
6. Highlighted the Palestinian right to self-determination.

Kamala Harris, in her keynote speech at the Democratic Convention, addresses the issue of the war in Gaza:

"And let me be clear. And let me be clear. I will always stand up for Israel’s right to defend itself, and I will always ensure Israel has the ability to defend itself, because the people of Israel must never again face the horror that a terrorist organization called Hamas caused on Oct. 7, including unspeakable sexual violence and the massacre of young people at a music festival.

At the same time, what has happened in Gaza over the past 10 months is devastating. So many innocent lives lost. Desperate, hungry people fleeing for safety, over and over again. The scale of suffering is heartbreaking.

President Biden and I are working to end this war, such that Israel is secure, the hostages are released, the suffering in Gaza ends and the Palestinian people can realize their right to dignity, security, freedom and self-determination."
